page.title: 16Young people in N.Upottery
page.content: There are not that many young families in our valley,but,although there seems to be little special provision for them,most seem content with country life.For the little ones there are Playgroups at Smeatharpe and Upottery and a lively primary school in Upottery,but after the age of eleven they are swept away to Honiton or Taunton,or even further afield,for their secondary schools. From then on,a lot of their spare time will be spent pursuing interests and friend- ships outside Upottery.There is a very popular Youth Club in Honiton.Local links remain strong,though,encouraged by the Young Farmers and by village discos.Older teenagers find that cars and mopeds make it easy to combine the joys of country life with the attractions offered by town and city.
